instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.BKL_PWM: What is BKL_PWM? BKL_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.BKL_EN: What is BKL_EN? BKL_EN enables backlight. Anytime you see a signal ending with “_EN” , that means this signal being present/high enables what it is referring to. This signal says “BKL” before “_EN”. “BKL” sounds short for “BACKLIGHT”, so it is safe to assume this signal enables backlight when present. .
definitions.PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT? PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the backlight on the LCD screen, this is necessary to get the screen to light up..
definitions.EDP_BKLT_PWM: What is EDP_BKLT_PWM? EDP_BKLT_PWM sets the brightness of the screen. The system will send a PWM signal to BKL_PWM pin to set brightness. If this is low, backlight voltage will boost higher than PPBUS_G3H input, but not enough to make the screen light properly..
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
A beer damage board turns on with no backlight. Tried SMC reset, capslock is active and there is USB activity
The backlight blinks for a second once when turns on.

<DIODE>D7701</DIODE> - 8.6v both sides
XW7720 - 8.6v and clean
<SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> - 2.83v
<SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> - 0v
All Return resistors 0.6Vdc

Removed <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and tied together <SIGNAL>BKL_EN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> and backlight stays on.
With the jumper, <SIGNAL>PPHV_S0SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is 24.4V


Does not seems to be <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>BKL_PWM</SIGNAL> comes from SMC, reflow?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> comes our from PCH.
SMC output is not connected...

Try PRAM reset 2-3 times.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> and its traces OK.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
With a soldered jumper backlight stays on but when I do a couple of PRAM reset's it goes off. Doesn't it suppose to get forced to stay on?

<RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> to <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR> seems fine, cannot test to Ball 4 on <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> though. Also cannot test <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL> to PCH either (TP1 on <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT_PWM</SIGNAL>  seems to be non-existent). Reflowed the <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> with no effect.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Are you sure <RESISTOR>R7704</RESISTOR> is good?
In the picture looks more like a cap; does it have 33 ohm?
You can just replace it with a short.
Also check continuity of its traces; right test point, for example.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message: Must have flipped the other way around while resoldering, but yeah measures to 33Ohm between <SIGNAL>EDP_BKLT</SIGNAL>+PWM and <CAPACITOR>C7704</CAPACITOR>. Also all traces are connected all the way to the test point.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Do you have backlight forcing PWM now?
If yes, do PRAM reset, rebuild original configuration and test again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Backlight
threads.message:
Soldered jumper forcing PWM, backlight stays on until I do couple PRAM resets. Then I lose it again. 
With the original configuration same thing, blinks once initially then no backlight.

<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL>?
[/QUOTE]


<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.4V 

Shall I go for <CHIP>U7710</CHIP> ?

threads.message: Should be good to change it.
